definitions: perform a narrative as if it were a play; translate something into action

examples.text: students were encouraged to act out the stories
were there any early indications that he was getting ready to act these fantasies out?

shortDefinitions: perform narrative in manner of play

definitions: express repressed or unconscious feelings in overt behavior

examples.text: the impulses of hatred and killing which some human beings act out

definitions: behave badly, especially when unhappy or stressed

examples.text: many children who act out while awaiting placement in a healthcare facility end up in juvenile detention
kids act out in school when their needs are not being met or there are other problems at home
